about_the_game:
In the midst of a boring and monotonous "ordinary" life, the protagonist, "I," begins to frequently dream of childhood aspirations for some unknown reason. There are no significant memories, and the elementary school days are far away, to the extent that I haven't even received any notifications about reunions.

One day, on an otherwise unremarkable morning, while commuting, "I" unexpectedly wanders into the childhood room once inhabited. It is a world where the boundary between dreams and reality is blurred. Memories of childhood, which had transformed into vague and pastoral images over many years, start to regain their original clarity.

Amidst a mix of nostalgia and anxiety, "I" is forced to confront my past. Will "I" be able to return to the real world from this labyrinth of memories? And what changes will this encounter with the past bring to "my" life?

[Game Overview]

CLASS 3, THIRD GRADE is a 3D first-person perspective escape game. Players take on the role of the protagonist, "I," exploring a nostalgic childhood room, collecting items necessary for escape, and solving various puzzles in order to return to the real world.

[Game Features]

  • A game world that faithfully recreates the atmosphere of the 1980s

  • Experience a childhood where nostalgia and reality intersect

  • Multiple endings: The truth changes depending on your choices

  • This game is not only "my" story but also "your" story

name: CLASS 3, THIRD GRADE

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows10(64bit),Windows11
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-9100
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1630
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows10(64bit),Windows11
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-12700K
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 512 MB available space

short_description: Through a strange coincidence, the protagonist 'I' stumbles into the childhood bedroom they once inhabited. It is a world where hazy memories of childhood vividly regain their original form. Will 'I' be able to return to the real world from this labyrinth of memories?
